summary: This is an internal DOJ email from August 24, 2019, providing an update on multiple investigations related to Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses the upcoming nolle prosequi hearing for Epstein's case, victim coordination, the death investigation revealing Epstein changed his will 36 hours before his death, and separate sex/drug and public corruption investigations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

persons.name: Lan
persons.context: Sender of the email forwarding an FBI update on the Epstein investigations. Appears to be a DOJ official (ODAG - Office of the Deputy Attorney General).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the sex trafficking investigation whose case SDNY is abandoning via a nolle prosequi hearing. His death investigation is also discussed, including the fact he changed his will 36 hours before his death.

persons.name: Shahada Harris
persons.context: Was provided an attorney and proffered on 8/22/2019 regarding a sex/drug investigation. A second proffer is scheduled. Her phones were seized and analyzed.

persons.name: Primary Co-conspirator
persons.context: Counsel for this individual has a meeting scheduled with the investigation team. The individual is referred to as the 'primary co-conspirator' in the sex trafficking investigation.

connections.description: The document refers to a 'primary co-conspirator' in the sex trafficking investigation, indicating a conspiratorial relationship with Epstein.
Initial analysis supports a link between Harris and a correction officer, investigated as part of a sex/drug probe at MCC.

events.title: Nolle Prosequi Hearing for Epstein
events.description: SDNY will formally abandon their case against Jeffrey Epstein at a hearing. Multiple victims are expected to speak. The FBI and SDNY are coordinating victim travel.

events.title: Shahada Harris Proffer
events.description: Shahada Harris was provided an attorney and gave a proffer session to investigators regarding a sex/drug investigation.

events.title: Epstein Changes Will Before Death
events.description: A psychiatrist advised that had they been informed Epstein changed his will 36 hours before his death, they would have placed him on suicide watch.

keyFacts: The SDNY planned to formally abandon its case against Jeffrey Epstein at a nolle prosequi hearing on August 27, 2019, with multiple victims expected to speak.
A psychiatrist stated that if they had known Epstein changed his will 36 hours before his death, they would have placed him on suicide watch.
Investigators were looking into a potential rape of a victim at Epstein's New Mexico residence but lacked probable cause for a search at the time.
A separate sex/drug investigation at MCC involved Shahada Harris and links to a correction officer.
A public corruption preliminary investigation at MCC was ongoing, interviewing personnel and inmates about potential cover-ups.
